page.title: 15Holidays and local events
page.content: Local events held on a regular basis seem to have been largely concerned with agriculture - the Hiring Fair was held in November in the neighbouring market town of Hedon. Most farm workers in Preston were made to go to Hedon and there they were either rehired or obtained another position with a different master. Scrimshanking, agreeing to work for more than one master in order to take the best was a problem. The hiring fair went on for one whole week and gradually deteriorated into a drunken brawl as farm labourers and young bloods took advantage of the Hedon people. Local Sunday school outings have been and still are a strong feature of life in Preston.
